intro: Arabis montbretiana, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, often blooming in early spring. Arabis montbretiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
